Configuration.Data_Provider:
TitleNameInstitute
Principal InvestigatorRichard Spritz, MDUniversity of Colorado School of Medicine, Aurora, CO USA
Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: FaceBase Study of Facial Shape in Tanzania: CIDR
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: FaceBase Study of Facial Shape in Tanzania: CIDR
Configuration.Description: The goals of this project are to identify loci that underlie major genetic determinants of orofacial shape, by means of a GWAS in a cohort of normal African children (from Tanzania) from whom we have collected 3D digitized facial morphometric scans, and a subsequent replication study of normal children from the same population. These studies are part of the NIDCR FaceBase initiative (https://www.facebase.org/). In addition to dbGaP, all study genotype and phenotype data (including primary facial scans and landmarks) will be available for data-sharing with qualified investigators via the NIDCR FaceBase Hub (www.facebase.org/), following approval by the NIDCR FaceBase Data Access Committee.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Inclusion: Tanzanian children aged 3-18, major ethic affiliation Bantu at level of all four grandparents

Exclusion: Any orofacial defect, any known birth defect, any known relatives with orofacial cleft, any non-Bantu grandparent

Disease.vocab_term: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities

Header.title: Principal Investigator
Header.Institution: University of Colorado School of Medicine, Aurora, CO USA

Url.name: Genetic Determinants of Orofacial Shape and Relationship to Cleft Lip/Palate

ConsentGroup.longName: Subjects did not participate in the study, did not complete a consent document and are included only for the pedigree structure and/or genotype controls, such as HapMap subjects

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: Use of the data must be related to Craniofacial Research. Use of these data is limited to research studies of facial shape or craniofacial birth defects.
